content: Enter the token to confirm revocation:

comment.text: This translation key is used for the "Enter token to confirm revocation" message in a dialog box, specifically in a Revoke Developer Token dialog. The purpose is to prompt the user to input a token to proceed with token revocation.

usage.context:
<div>
 <Text style={{ marginBottom: "16px" }}>
 {t("OAuth:RevokeDialogDescription")}
 </Text>
 <Text style={{ marginBottom: "16px" }}>
 {t("OAuth:RevokeDialogEnterToken")}
 </Text>
 <FieldContainer
 hasError={!!tokenError}
 errorMessage={tokenError}
 removeMargin

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Ləğv etməyi təsdiqləmək üçün tokeni daxil edin:' is overly literal and slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing would improve readability.
The colon after 'daxil edin:' feels slightly unnatural in this context.

The translation 'Zadejte token a potvrďte odvolání:' is not the most natural or precise translation of 'Enter the token to confirm revocation:'. 'Potvrďte odvolání' is more literally 'confirm the revocation' which isn't as direct as confirming the action.

While technically correct, "Syötä tunnus vahvistaaksesi peruutuksen: " is a rather literal translation and doesn't flow as naturally in Finnish. 'Tunnus' translates to 'token' but in this context, a more natural phrasing would convey the purpose of entering the token.
The colon (:) should be followed by a space in Finnish, as per standard conventions.
The translation 'Մուտքագրեք token-ը չեղյալ հայտարարելու համար՝' is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Armenian. 'չեղյալ հայտարարելու համար' is quite verbose and could be simplified.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Մուտքագրեք token-ը հրամանմանելու համար։ (Enter the token to invalidate/cancel).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon (:) at the end of the Armenian translation isn't standard for this kind of prompt and might look awkward. The suggested translation removes the colon.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the colon at the end of the translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'ໂຕ໊ກຽນ' is a transliteration of 'token' and might not be the most natural or easily understood word for Lao speakers. While understandable, a more idiomatic Lao equivalent would be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more natural Lao term for 'token', potentially researching common usage in similar contexts.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Introduceți token-ul pentru a confirma revocare:' is a literal translation but could be improved for naturalness in Romanian. 'Revocare' isn't as commonly used in this context as 'anulare'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Introduceți token-ul pentru a confirma anularea:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "පරි revoke කිරීම තහවුරු කිරීමට ටෝකනය ඇතුළත් කරන්න:" while containing relevant keywords, doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "Enter the token to confirm revocation:". The phrasing is a bit awkward and unnatural in Sinhala. It directly translates 'revoke' which is not common in conversational Sinhala.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be something like "පරිrevoke කිරීමට අවසර දීමට ටෝකනය ඇතුළත් කරන්න" (Par revoke karamuna avasam damma ekak thokanaya athulath karanna) or "පරි revoke කිරීමට අවශ්‍ය ටෝකනය ඇතුළත් කරන්න" (Par revoke karamuna awashyatha thokanaya athulath karanna).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon (:) at the end of the Sinhala translation, while grammatically valid, might be stylistically different from the English version. Consistency should be checked across all translations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Evaluate if the colon is consistently used in similar UI elements in Sinhala.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Унесите токен за потврду опозива:' is a literal translation and sounds awkward in Serbian. 'Potvrda' is more formal than necessary. A more natural phrasing would use a synonym for 'confirm' that fits the context of revocation.

The translation 'Unesite token za potvrdu opoziva:' while understandable, is not the most natural or precise translation of 'Enter the token to confirm revocation:'. A more accurate and idiomatic translation would be 'Unesite token za potvrdjivanje opoziva:' or 'Unesite token kako biste potvrdili opoziv:'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Unesite token kako biste potvrdili opoziv:
